result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander William Novak

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander William Novak not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Alexander William Novak.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Alexander William Novak appeared by video.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is trying to retain counsel and would like more time.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-07-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Skyline Gas Mart.

Defendant Alexander William Novak in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 2:30p
